newsitem.title: USA: NYSE suspends trade in Mid-American Waste.
newsitem.headline: NYSE suspends trade in Mid-American Waste.

text.p: The New York Stock Exchange said Wednesday it had suspended trading in the common stock of Mid-American Waste Systems Inc with the intention of eventually delisting the issue.
The exchange said it will make an application to the Securities and Exchange Commission to delist the issue because the company was selling all of its assets.

On January 21, Mid-American Waste Systems said it had filed for bankruptcy. A day later, it said it had executed a definitive agreement to sell "substantially all" of its assets to USA Waste Services Inc.

The exchange said the company had also fallen below its continued listing criteria relating to net tangible assets available to common stock (less than $12 million), together with three-year average net income (less than $600,000).
